captionText: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
author: Thomas Merton

captionText: Every artist was first an amateur.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

captionText: Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.
author: Oscar Wilde

captionText: Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
author: Pablo Picasso

captionText: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
author: Pablo Picasso

captionText: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
author: Edgar Degas

captionText: Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable.
author: Banksy

captionText: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
author: Pablo Picasso

captionText: Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.
author: Twyla Tharp

captionText: Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
author: Theodore Dreiser

captionText: Art is a harmony parallel with nature.
author: Paul Cézanne

captionText: Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
author: Amy Lowell

captionText: Art is not a handicraft, it is the transmission of feeling the artist has experienced.
author: Leo Tolstoy

captionText: Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.
author: Oscar Wilde

captionText: The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work.
author: Emile Zola
